snippet: Europe’s recent tepid growth shows how cutting government spending and raising taxes have prolonged the recession.
abstract: Editorial contends tepid growth of European Union's economy in the three months that ended in June, which was best quarterly figure since early 2011, indicates austerity policies have prolonged European recession; criticizes those who insist that the faint recovery shows that their austerity policies have succeeded.
lead_paragraph: Europe’s recent tepid growth shows how cutting government spending and raising taxes have prolonged the recession.

headline.main: Learning the Wrong Lessons About Austerity
headline.print_headline: Learning the Wrong Lessons About Austerity
